1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Position on code string.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Base.Abort.CodePos
7  ( -- * Code position
8    CodePos,
9    TCodePos (..),
10    cpCharNo,
11    cpSplit,
12
13    -- * Get code positions
14    GetCodePos (..),
15
16    -- * Codic
17    Codic (..),
18    codic, noCodic,
19  ) where
20
21import qualified Data.List                          as Li
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture           as O
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude       as B
24
25
26-- ----------------------  CodePos
27
28-- | Code position of string code.
29type CodePos = TCodePos String
30
31-- | Position on input code.
32data TCodePos t = CodePos
33      { cpIndex      :: O.Ix       -- ^ Index of code source
34      , cpPath       :: O.IOPath   -- ^ Path of code source
35      , cpLineNo     :: Int        -- ^ Line number
36      , cpLineText   :: t          -- ^ Code line
37      , cpText       :: t          -- ^ Current code text
38      } deriving (Eq)
39
40-- | Number of input point, line number, and character number,
41--   e.g., @\/1.6.14\/@.
42instance (O.Textual t) => Show (TCodePos t) where
43    show = showCp posText
44
45instance Functor TCodePos where
46    fmap f cp@CodePos { cpLineText = line, cpText = text } =
47        cp { cpLineText = f line, cpText = f text }
48
49instance O.GetIx (TCodePos t) where
50    getIx = cpIndex
51
52instance O.GetIOPath (TCodePos t) where
53    getIOPath = cpPath
54
55posText :: String -> String -> String -> String
56posText s l c = "/" ++ s ++ "." ++ l ++ "." ++ c ++ "/"
57
58showCp :: (O.Textual t) => (String -> String -> String -> String) -> TCodePos t -> String
59showCp f cp = f s l c where
60    s = show $ O.getIx cp
61    l = show $ cpLineNo cp
62    c = show $ cpCharNo cp
63
64instance (O.Textual t) => Ord (TCodePos t) where
65    compare = cpCompare
66
67cpCompare :: (O.Textual t) => TCodePos t -> TCodePos t -> Ordering
68cpCompare p1 p2 = line O.++ char where
69    line = cpLineNo p1 `compare` cpLineNo p2
70    char = cpTextLength p2 `compare` cpTextLength p1
71
72cpTextLength :: (O.Textual t) => TCodePos t -> Int
73cpTextLength = O.tLength . cpText
74
75-- | Empty code position, i.e., empty content and zero line number.
76instance (O.Textual t) => B.Default (TCodePos t) where
77    def = CodePos { cpIndex    = 0
78                  , cpPath     = O.tEmpty
79                  , cpLineNo   = 0
80                  , cpLineText = O.tEmpty
81                  , cpText     = O.tEmpty }
82
83-- | Character position at which code starts.
84--
85--   >>> let cp = B.def { cpLineText = "abcdefg", cpText = "defg" }
86--   >>> cp
87--   /0.0.3/
88--   >>> cpCharNo cp
89--   3
90--
91cpCharNo :: (O.Textual t) => TCodePos t -> Int
92cpCharNo CodePos { cpLineText = line, cpText = subline }
93    = O.tLength line - O.tLength subline
94
95-- | Before and after text of code position.
96--
97--   >>> cpSplit $ CodePos 0 "<stdin>" 1 "abcdefg" "defg"
98--   ("abc", "defg")
99--
100cpSplit :: CodePos -> (String, String)
101cpSplit CodePos { cpLineText = ln, cpText = t } =
102    case tStripSuffix t ln of
103      Just s  -> (s, t)
104      Nothing -> (ln, t)
105
106-- >>> tStripSuffix "defg" "abcdefg"
107-- Just "abc"
108tStripSuffix :: (O.Textual t) => t -> t -> Maybe t
109tStripSuffix suf s = stripped where
110    stripped = (O.stringT . reverse) <$> Li.stripPrefix suf' s'
111    suf'     = reverse $ O.tString suf
112    s'       = reverse $ O.tString s
113
114
115-- ----------------------  GetCodePos
116
117-- | Type which has code positions.
118class GetCodePos a where
119    getCPs :: a -> [CodePos]
120
121    getCP :: a -> CodePos
122    getCP a = B.headNull B.def $ getCPs a
123
124instance GetCodePos CodePos where
125    getCPs cp  = [cp]
126    getCP  cp  =  cp
127
128instance (GetCodePos cp) => GetCodePos [cp] where
129    getCPs = concatMap getCPs
130
131
132-- ----------------------  Codic
133
134-- | Value with code string.
135data Codic a =
136    Codic { codicCPs :: [CodePos]    -- ^ Code positions.
137          , uncodic  :: a            -- ^ Value.
138          } deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
139
140instance Functor Codic where
141    fmap f (Codic cp a) = Codic cp $ f a
142
143instance GetCodePos (Codic a) where
144    getCPs = codicCPs
145
146-- | Create value with code position.
147codic :: (GetCodePos cp) => cp -> a -> Codic a
148codic cp = Codic $ getCPs cp
149
150-- | Create codic value without code string.
151noCodic :: a -> Codic a
152noCodic = Codic []
153
